Package com.jjjwelectronics.scale

Class AbstractElectronicScale

java.lang.Object
com.jjjwelectronics.AbstractDevice<ElectronicScaleListener>
com.jjjwelectronics.scale.AbstractElectronicScale
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDevice<ElectronicScaleListener>, IElectronicScale
Direct Known Subclasses:
ElectronicScale
public abstract class AbstractElectronicScale extends AbstractDevice<ElectronicScaleListener> implements IElectronicScale
Abstract base class of electronic scales on which can be placed one or more items. Scales have a sensitivity: changes to the mass smaller than this will go unnoticed. Scales have a mass limit as well; when the items on the scale are heavier than this limit, the scale cannot operate.

Different models in our product line have different levels of sensitivity, different mass limits, and different and different precisions.

Author:
JJJW Electronics LLP

  • Method Details

    • getMassLimit

      public Mass getMassLimit()
      Description copied from interface: IElectronicScale
      Gets the mass limit for the scale. Masses greater than this will not be measurable by the scale, but will cause overload. Does not require power.
      Specified by:
      getMassLimit in interface IElectronicScale
      Returns:
      The mass limit.

    • getSensitivityLimit

      public Mass getSensitivityLimit()
      Description copied from interface: IElectronicScale
      Gets the sensitivity of the scale. Changes smaller than this limit are not noticed or announced. Does not require power.
      Specified by:
      getSensitivityLimit in interface IElectronicScale
      Returns:
      The sensitivity.

    • addAnItem

      public void addAnItem(Item item)
      Description copied from interface: IElectronicScale
      Adds an item to the scale. If the addition is successful, a "mass changed" event is announced. If the mass is greater than the mass limit, announces "overload" event. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      addAnItem in interface IElectronicScale
      Parameters:
      item - The item to add.

    • removeAnItem

      public void removeAnItem(Item item)
      Description copied from interface: IElectronicScale
      Removes an item from the scale. If the operation is successful, announces "mass changed" event. If the scale was overloaded and this removal causes it to no longer be overloaded, announces "outOfOverload" event. Does not require power.
      Specified by:
      removeAnItem in interface IElectronicScale
      Parameters:
      item - The item to remove.

      public Mass getCurrentMassOnTheScale() throws OverloadedDevice
      Gets the current mass on the scale. Requires power.
      Returns:
      The current mass.
      Throws:
      OverloadedDevice - If the mass has overloaded the scale.
